Posts.EditableText: I created a telephone that when you dial a number it links to a youtube video and plays it. But when I go to test in game it says: "You must install Adobe Flash Player for Internet Explorer for videos to work" But Flash player is installed, for IE. I searched this forum for this error message and was surprised to only get one result which did not contain a solution. Can anyone help here? Thanks!
Posts.HTML:
I created a telephone that when you dial a number it links to a youtube video and plays it.

But when I go to test in game it says:

"You must install Adobe Flash Player for Internet Explorer for videos to work"

But Flash player is installed, for IE.

I searched this forum for this error message and was surprised to only get one result which did not contain a solution.

Can anyone help here?


Thanks!

Posts.EditableText:
do you have the most recent version of adobe flash player? do you have the most recent version of IE ? computer model and speks... etc etc etc, laughs.

other possible things needed:

1. '.net' downloads, I think the most recent .net now doesn't require also having ~.net 3.5 (which caused some problem for someone trying to use quest as they had ~ .net 4.0, which was missing some functionality that ~ .net 3.5 gave, which they didn't have downloaded)

2. 'java' downloads

Posts.EditableText:
1. are you using online~web browser or offline~desktop version of quest?

2. can you play youtube videos normally on~with your computer?

3. the .net downloads

4. possibly there's some setting in IE, to allow for flash player or maybe it involves an 'activeX' control setting too... but this is beyond my knowledge...

5. if applicable, make sure your IE, flash, and quest is 64 bit version downloads, for your 64 bit version win 7 OS

Posts.EditableText: There's possibly a way to play video within Quest using html5. My earlier experiments were a dismal failure, but that was before I found out that Quest disregards some file types upon publish, which can be overridden as of Quest 5.6. I need to have a play around with that again.

Posts.EditableText: I've never tried to use YouTube vids in a game. I was talking about the possibility of playing a video from within the .quest file itself using html5 video tags. The reason why I initially explored that was I thought it would look inconsistent for a YouTube vid with control bar suddenly appearing in a game, where as you can utilise auto play with html5 with no control bar. Although it wouldn't work for mobile devices as mobile browsers don't support auto play.
Posts.HTML: I've never tried to use YouTube vids in a game. I was talking about the possibility of playing a video from within the .quest file itself using html5 video tags. The reason why I initially explored that was I thought it would look inconsistent for a YouTube vid with control bar suddenly appearing in a game, where as you can utilise auto play with html5 with no control bar. Although it wouldn't work for mobile devices as mobile browsers don't support auto play.
